intro: Impatiens luteoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-green impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-green foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually orange to yellow in color, with five petals and a distinct spur. Impatiens luteoviridis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories.
